I love this place. Been going ever since I lived in the neighborhood. The lemon chicken is delicious, the won ton soup is killer (nice and peppery). Good fried rice.

You will NOT enjoy this place if you like super greasy chinese. The food here is not very greasy at all, which I quite enjoy !
author: Arturo L.

description:
Hooray! Good Chinese food in the Richmond!

I really liked this place. Clean, cute, family-run (the two kids were there to greet me when I came to pick up my order), and the food was very good. Yes, the Dry Fried Chicken Wings are on par with San Tung's, and you don't have to wait 45 minutes outside in the cold for a table. We also got the Prawns with Honey Walnuts (tasty) and the Beef and Tomato Chow Mein, which was also solid, but I might try something else next time.

Anyway, you should probably go now before word gets out and the place gets too crowded.
author: Todd K.

description:
New lovely neighborhood Chinese restaurant. 
The family that owns this place makes you feel like you are eating at a family member's house. We have an eight month old and they are always so accommodating. 
The food is delicious! Every dish we've ordered has been wonderfully fresh and tasty.  The dishes are never oily and never too salty. These are my favorite dishes.

Dry Fried Chicken Wings- We have ordered this dish every time we've come here and always a hit. Crispy wings with a sweet and spicy sauce. 

Basil Eggplant with Pork- My favorite dish so far. Its just a perfect combination of flavors. The basil is not over powering and the eggplant is cooked perfectly. 

The Dry Fried String Beans with Tofu -  The tofu are fried crispy pieces and a perfect compliment to the string beans. 

Sizzling Rice Soup- delicious savory broth with shrimp, chicken and spinach. They bring the bowl of soup and sizzling rice to the table and combine them right before serving so you actually hear the sizzle. 

We will definitely be repeat customers.
author: Maria B.

description:
We bicycled over to this restaurant the other night based on the good Yelp reviews.  It is a very pleasant and clean little restaurant.  We had a nice chat with the owner, Christina (she is from China, presumably that is her Americanized name).  Her husband is the chef in the kitchen, and she seems to do most everything else, with some help from her two kids and another employee.  Christina said that she and her family operated two different Chinese restaurants in China, but that this is their first restaurant since coming to the US about 7 years ago.

Anyway, we tried two dishes, the Veggie Delight and the Singapore Noodles, and we enjoyed both dishes.  We also had a side of brown rice, which was unusually good.  Two dishes was more than we could eat, so Rita had the rest of the Veggie Delight the next day, and it re-heated well.  The dishes tasted very fresh and not greasy.  The owner Christina says that they will be expanding the menu shortly, and adding more vegetarian dishes, including a vegetarian version of their chicken wings!
author: Matt and Rita C.

description:
The service was what did it for me. All smiles and friendly demeanors. The food was also tasty, but not because it was filled with sodium and spice. It was tasty because of the quality of the ingredients. 

For $5.42 I got some awesome soup and naan. Great little spot to have lunch.
author: Carlos C.

description:
Great for catered delivery! We had a lot of food delivered to our home for a Chinese New Year party. Food was a big hit!

Great wings, egg rolls, veggie fried rice, and dumplings! Food came in tins, ready to be placed on our serving tray burners. 

Christina was great, and helped us make the right good choices.
author: Brent T.

description: Tough parking between 5-6pm on Sunday evening. Finally parked on 7th Ave and walk 5 blocks to 3rd Ave. Spinach tofu soup good and light. Fried dry chicken wings would be bland without their sauce. Salt and pepper fried fish good. Egg plant tofu just okay. Green beans and tofu good. Seems like they deep fried everything and bring to table very hot. Overall, okay place to eat although they have maybe only 10 small tables in restaurant.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Another Chinese restaurant on Clement st?  Normally I would just walk by, which I have done multiple times until one day we got an office lunch catered there and OMG THEY HAVE THE BEST CHICKEN WINGS, EVER!

We ordered over $200 worth of food and everything was great but the highlight for me was their honey walnut prawns and their chicken wings!!  Other reviewers have compared them to San Tung's but it's been a while since I've been there.  All I know is that these are great and I work only blocks away.  Yes, I will be back for more!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
I came to Tenglong with my parents, friend, and her parents. We were looking for a Chinese restaurant that wasn't too classy but was great quality.  Unfortunately, Tenglong Chinese Restaurant isn't that kind of place. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is very casual and local. I do not live in San Francisco, and it felt as though it was more of a small take-out joint for the locals around Clement Street. All the dishes we sampled at Tenglong were bland and mediocre. I was very disappointed. The food took a while to come out of the kitchen (15-30 minutes). However, Tenglong excels in one thing, even if it is not their food. It is their customer service. The staff is incredibly friendly and kind. 

Tenglong is also very clean, which is a rarity in a Chinese restaurant.  Finding parking is extremely hard too. This is why I assume Tenglong is for residents of the area/locals. I don't think I will come back here.
author: Emmanuella Z.

description:
1. Dry Fried Flounder Filet - 4/5
The fish was sooo tender inside, and the sauce is slightly sweet and thick, and tasted SO good with white rice!

2. Basil Spicy Eggplant - 4/5
A little heavy on the sauce, but great flavor!

3. Tomato Beef Chow Mein - 4/5
First time having tomato beef chow mein, and it was really good! It was like...Chinese Spaghetti haha, but better!

4. Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings - 5/5
BETTER THAN SAN TUNG AND SHANGHAI HOUSE AND MARNEE THAI!!! I swear these wings are SO delicious!!!!!
author: Liz W.

description: Black bean sauce noodles are nothing like they should be. The sauce is brown instead of black, and thin instead of thick. Had to eat it still unfortunately, since I'm running Bay to Breakers tomorrow. Oh well. Wings are still good though.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Oooh, it's dangerous that I live right around the corner...

My husband and I ordered take out last night. It was our first time trying it.
The food was AWESOME.

We ordered Spring Rolls (they were out of green onion cakes, that's the ONLY reason I gave 4 stars and not 5)
Pork with Hot Peppers-NOT for the faint of heart. I'm not sure if my husband enjoyed sweating that much over dinner.
Dry Fried Wings-Heaven
Veggie Fried Rice-tasty and not greasy

It was ready in 15 min and the price is right!

Can't wait to try other dishes-although I'm going to have to limit myself to once a week or I'm not going to start off my year the way I planned!  ;)
author: Jaque H.

description:
Excellent service, cleanliness and quality of food! Amazing lunch specials and speedy delivery service! I ordered the veggie delight and indeed it was delightful. I've had the crispy chicken, amazing. The owner won awards for his sweet and sour sauce in China, I cannot wait to come back and try that.

 This is my only go to Chinese spot in the neighborhood. It was long overdue!
author: Jenise C.

description:
This newly opened establishment is off to a solid start.  I had the wonton soup which had savory, not too salty broth.  The veggies were simple, and the stars of the show were the dumplings.  Bulbous, with perfectly cooked ground meat, they didn't taste frozen - I'm willing to bet they fill them before cooking, which may change later for expediting reasons.

After debating between the pot stickers and the green onion pancake, the veggie option won (although I am of the opinion that when it comes to Chinese you can never have enough dumpling related dishes), and while most restaurants over-oil this entree, at Teng Long, it was good.  The curry sauce was just the right amount of spicy, enhancing the oft "just okay" dish.

Ambiance was that of a typically modern Chinese restaurant.  Minimal yet practical decor, attentive service that embodies a more American mentality, yet some things never change - the family business vibe, traditional colors and plants.  These are the things I hope will always stay the same in these places.

Some suggestions for the fledgling business - veggie options that include faux meat, perhaps a house made iced tea, and one unique dessert.  You don't see the last two in many Chinese restaurants and I really think it will give them an edge over other restaurants on Geary, for example.

But other than that...great first impression, Teng Long!
author: Lily E.

description: The food was good and the service was o.k. soft drinks are not refillable...  Considering the prices they are charging for the food this costed them a star...
author: Jerry L.

description:
Like Al Pacino in Scarface always says, "Issss Okay."

The best part of this restaurant is the friendly staff.  The food was decent but nothing special.  If I was in the neighborhood and needed to eat I would come back but I would never go out of my way to come eat here.  I feel kind of bad saying that because they are so nice but it is the truth.
author: Brian S.

description: went for lunch and ordered the tofu, eggplant, and dry sauteed green beans, which proved to be mildly flavorful at best. my mistake may have been my attempt to go veggie for this meal, as the guy to my right ordered a massive meat platter, and looked pleased about it. either way, it's quick and inexpensive Chinese food but nothing worth raving about.
author: Ronny K.

description: Good service.  Best place to eat in the area. This is one of my favorite places to come for dinner or lunch. Their eggplant and chicken, wonton soup, dry fried diced chicken and Mongolian beef are taste very good.  The price for everything is quite reasonable and affordable.
author: Yan Y.

description:
Definitely a 5 again. I have eaten here several times and it is heavenly. Last time we had the vegetarian sweet & sour chicken which was amazing, I love their sauce, the pineapple, peppers & onions were fresh and the "chicken" was some sort of balls (I'd swear Ive seen them in the frozen section of lien hing market up the street) and they were excellent.

Also had the vegetarian chow mein which was amazingly good, fresh noodles, good flavored sauce, lots of cabbage & carrots and other veggies but not too much. 

The egg rolls are perfectly done. The female owner is the sweetest person you could imagine! 5 stars all the way. I'm so glad there is finally a chinese restaurant on Clement that I can relate to as a vegetarian.
author: Venus S.

description: Hmm. Maybe Tenglong was a fluke? Tried it for takeout again and I tried the Cashew Nut Chicken. I'm pretty convinced that they instead gave me the tofu "chicken" because it really tasted like other vegan meat i've had before. The fried rice was nothing special and I would have liked more vegetables and beef in it. I think i'm going back to my old faithful - Nan King Road Bistro.
author: Dana J.

description:
Solid food!  The dry fried chicken wings are indeed just like San Tung's.  My husband even thought their's is better than San Tung's, but I thought it was at least on par.  Their eggplant was good, Dan Dan noodles were pretty good, and the salt and pepper shrimp definitely had the right flavor although they do it without shell here.

I got carry out and my food took forever (they said 20 min on the phone and I got there and waited another 20).  But to their credit, the lady in front (the owner and chef's wife) apologized and explained they had a mishap with the kitchen staff that morning.  Not awesome to have to wait that long, but I give credit to places that will acknowledge that they screwed up (we all do sometimes).  And she was super friendly and made sure I had water and tea while I waited.  Definitely not your standard 'Chinese service'!
author: j k.

description: Chinese food is tasty!  They're always friendly and super attentive!  The shrimp glazed walnut is delicious.  Nice and quiet clean atmosphere too.  I recommend if your In the area and looking for Chinese food.
author: Jennifer V.

description: I'm not a big fan of this "genre" of food but this place is nice. Clean. Owner/server is friendly and helpful. The food needs a kick to it , but the ambience is very soothing. I stick to -no land animals dishes- but I can see their dry fried wings must be amazing for chicken lovers. Ask the server/owner what she recommends because she is very accommodating. I would go here again and again when someone wants shrimp chow mein.
author: Me M.

description: This place is the worst tasting Chinese food I've yet to eat in the city. The fried rice was poor quality and the meat was disgusting. I don't even want to know where the shrimp came from, because it tasted like dirt. The only good thing about this place was the service.
author: Marco L.

description: We were in search for a place to eat yesterday and we saw this on yelp. We are so happy that we have picked this place. The place is clean and the person who helped us was very friendly. As far as the food, we loved what we ordered. My favorite was the spicy ma po tofu w/ minced pork. Everything (all 4 dishes) we ordered was good. My family enjoyed everything. We will be back. ... The basil spicy eggplant chicken was sooooo good too
author: Larry M.

description: My roommate and I ordered food from here on a random night through Eat24...and let me tell ya, we were very pleasantly surprised. The food was really good and the price was even better!! Highly recommend this place, although I haven't been to their actual location, the food made a name for itself!
author: George M.

description: Good service, okay food, and a clean restaurant, the only thing i do not like about this place is that the people who work there constantly stared at my friend and i and then would turn around and talk, i am not sure if it was about us, but it was enough to make us feel very uncomfortable by the end of our dinner.
author: Zo M.

description: this place is excellent     really clean food   great service   good atmosphere
author: Robert E.

description: Very friendly.  Food bland and overly salted.  Shanghai noodles almost inedible due to salt.  Meatless sesame chicken gooey and not very flavorful, no veggies at all.  Scallion pancake was good.  Spinach with garlic delicious.  Green beans with tofu good texture wise, but too salty also.  2 1/2stars.
author: Kj S.

description: Super yummy..Yeah it is no Sing Tang..however they deliver and the food was food.
author: Rayannah S.

description:
Ordered delivery on a Sunday evening and got $30 of bland slop for dinner. If a restaurant has Szichuan items on its menu, specifically calls them out as spicy, and the customer still specifies "very very spicy", they should at least have a little kick to them. The lack of any flavor or spice in the "SPICY" mapo tofu and dry cook "SPICY" chicken was a huge letdown. The Singapore noodles were also just incredibly bland, and I wasn't expecting much with them to begin with. 

I never throw away leftovers, but I had a few bites of each of these and tossed them. No amount of soy sauce, Sriracha, chili paste, chili oil and/or Mae Ploy could undo the terrible injustice done to these dishes.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Nice place. Very clean, not crowdy. Portions are not huge, but the food is tasty.
author: Pavel S.

description: This is our absolute favorite spot for calling in delivery. Besides their food being soooo yummy, their delivery time is super quick!  Their sweet and sour chicken is finger lickin good. We love the potstickers too!
author: Jacqueline Z.

description: The dried fried chicken wings had a FUUUNKY smell.  They were spicy (me like), too sweet (ehhh) & were NOT good tasty (me NO happy)  Chow mein was kinda hard and it barely had any veggies!   Big fat BOOOOOO! :-/
author: Lissette T.

description:
We ordered the dry fried shrimp, a pricier item, and the sweet sour pork...both failed...

First, the sweet sour pork was suppose to have carrots, red peppers, and onions in it...it only came with a ton of white onions while the other veggies listed for this dish were missing...hmmm, doesn't the cook know what items go into each dish?--it's listed  on the menu...also, the sweet sour sauce was something you'd get at a grocery store and the pork was old tasting. I have had fresher better tasting sweet sour pork at dive chinese places, where expectations are low.

Now to the dry fried shrimp...a pricier dish on their menu at $13. The shrimp tasted like iodine, horrible, and the garlic sauce did not taste of any garlic, but just of white pepper. The dish was missing the bamboo, carrots, mushrooms, which were listed as a part of this dish.

The sauces for both dishes were rather bland, one dimensional...and I am not talking about the heat index, just the flavor index. Heat doesn't make up for lack of flavor.

Bottom line is--there are so many tastier places to have Chinese in SF---
Mind that I am not saying "great" places, just better places.
We were looking for better quality Chinese food, and this place was disappointing.

It seems like they are cutting corners.
Shame on you Tenglong, because Clement street is full of vegetable and asian food stores, so that there is no excuse for missing ingredients in a dish...it just feels lazy to me...

We will not be returning...very disappointing.
author: Elektra T.

description:
eh, I've had better... but their delivery is super fast! they are always quicker than they say they will be.

sweet and sour pork is good, but they go a little heavy on the sauce. wish they offered sweet and sour chicken!

their chicken chow mein was kind of bland and the noodles were a weird texture. probably healthier than most places, but kind of a disappointment :(
author: Sam D.

description: After a long day at the a California Academy of Sciences the family was super hungry. Found this gem on Yelp and decided to give it a go. So glad we did.  We has 4 adults and 4 kids (ages 8-16). The hostesses was very friendly and sat us all together. We proceeded to order a variety of food including green onion pancake, spring rolls, chicken wings, combo chow mein, garlic chicken, sesame chicken, broccoli shrimp, tofu with green beans, and steamed rice. All the food was super delicious and full of flavor. My favorite items were the green onion pancake, sesame chicken, and tofu with green beans. We are everything and there were no left overs. Honestly it's the best Chinese food I've ever had. I can't wait to go back!
author: Raudel W.

description: I love this place. Service is always friendly and efficient. Clean interior too. My faves are the stringbeans with tofu, beef in oyster sauce, shrimp fried rice and mushu pork. Easily my favorite Chinese restaurant for dinner.
author: Tina C.

description: We ordered "vegetables deluxe" for takeout and we got a boxful of cabbage. Seriously (see photos.) When I called to enquire about the dish, the hostess knew EXACTLY why I was calling, apologized, and offered a refund. There are too many restaurants in the neighborhood for you to settle for this BAD quality.  (We also got another dish that was cooked erroneously and very sub-par, but wasn't as egregiously made.)
author: H N.

description:
Pro: good food, friendly staffs

Con: Hot & sour came out 40 min after the order and the place is empty. First dish came out 20 min after the soup and it was fried chicken wings.  Each dish came out 20 min apart.  That is not how successful chinese restaurant operate. Two chefs in the kitchen.
author: Jeff O.

description: wonderful place, nice people. i love their chicken wing, sweet and sour pork. hope next time i can go with my friends. thanks for their sever.
author: Jin L.

description: Got the dry chicken, dan dan noodles and fried ice cream.  All great, first time costumer, hope this quality continues...
author: josh d.

description: This place serves good, fresh Chinese fare. Friendly staff, very clean environment. I would give it at least 4 stars if not for the skimpy portions. The Mu Shu, for example, is mostly cabbage (cheap) and if you add a protein you have to sift through the veggies to find the few bits. Why then is it $9+? It's super yummy though. I respect quality food over quantity, and am not someone who typically eats HUGE portions but believe in getting what you pay for and some consistency. Step it up Tenglong and your business will go a "long" way!
author: Cara G.

description: Tenglong is a small restaurant with good tasting food and great customer service. Portions were a bit small for the prices a bit high. We had the hot and sour soup, dry fried chicken wings and chicken with garlic string beans.
author: Bruce J.

description: Great Chinese food and good service.
author: George Z.

description: Friend lives around the corner, it was win thin walking distance. Potstickers are amazing and the chow mein is good! :)
author: Kayla R.

description: I have been several more times and while I still like Tenglong, I am not convinced they are MSG free, as I inquired and received the "we use it only when we need to" answer, which does not inspire faith.  I've also now had some meh dish execution especially under duress.  Luckily the restaurant is quiet so the chances of major duress under heavy cover fire remains only for the rare occasion there is a customer onslaught, or someone in the kitchen calls out sick.  Its a small operation, ultimately with a good heart and a great wing which is what still brings me in on a "wing and a prayer".  Downgrade one star.  Steady as she goes.
author: Kevin M.

description: This place is great. Love the Singapore noodles, the wings, and the Mongolian beef. pancake was meh. Definitely will be coming back. Cheap, clean (really nice bathroom and orchids at every table!) and friendly service too. Mmm mmm.
author: Natasha F.

description: Home-style authentic Chinese food prepared simply.  The kitchen and premises (even the bathroom) are incredibly clean.  The food did was not incredible -- e.g., the house-made wontons were tasty, but one-dimensional (essentially pork meatballs wrapped in wonton skins) -- but did I mention how clean this place is?  Service is friendly though slow.
author: Chris T.

description:
I'm a regular here. I like this place. The food is good quality and well prepared.
They make an effort with presentation.

The lemon chicken is killer and so are the sautéed green beans.

The waitress and the owner are very friendly.
author: arthur l.

description: They just opened a week ago but the food tasted lile they've been opened for a long time....granted im only 24 ...im a native and so far this is the best chinese food ive ever had...and the service was unbelivable!...my mom mentioned it was her b-day and they surprused all four of us with ice cream and whip cream!!!!! Dude seriously this place is amazing..the food tasted authentic it wasnt super greasy like most places..thank you soooo much teng long i wish you lots of business and prosperity!!!
author: David G.

description:
Walked into this restaurant after taking a look at their menu.
It looked exactly like San Tung's--had the exact same signature dishes, with the same names.
Figured it was a possible second location or started by an old chef.
Ultimately, I decided to order the Dry Fried Chicken--it was bomb dot com and might I dare say, I liked it better than San Tung's. 
First, the sauce was on point, perhaps a little more pepper than San Tung's but I def enjoyed the extra kick. And second, the chicken drumsticks and wings were much meatier than San Tung's.
As I departed, I spoke to the owners about the obvious similarity with San Tung, and they claimed there wasn't any connection. 
Don't believe that at all, but why does that matter? They make awesome wings.
author: R C.

description: This place is very solid. The dry fried chicken is better than san tung in my opinion. It is spicier and has better flavor, not to mention no wait. As of today, it is my best kept secret in the inner richmond!
author: Sam L.

description:
Small restaurant, neat & shinny.
They apparently are not trying to be "cheap Chinese food", but the food is delicious.
They apparently do "crispy fried" very well.  Their fried flounder was absolutely outstanding, as was Honey Walnut Prawns.  Chow mein is tasty.  Everything is fresh-tasting and judiciously cooked (w/o msg & not greasy).  Really nice.
Service was friendly.
We will be back to try many other enticing things on the menu.
author: Vera P.

description:
Who are people kidding? Pot Stickers? Must be the ones from Costco...tiny no-filling things. Should be called gyozas. Went twice after folks said this was the new San Tung. Aint nowhere close!
Over priced to boot! Now, I will admit the owner was friendly, but I aint going there to crack a smile.
And for you folks, they're from Dongguan...not particularly known as a haven for. gourmet food in China. If I want those prices, Im going elsewhere for much better food or value. Another hipster (today's yuppy) joint.
author: Art Y.

description:
Two stars for cleanliness. The rest? I've definitely had better. Service was horribly slow, to the point where I thought they had just forgotten about our order.

I've never had the San Tung wings so I don't have those to compare the wings here to, but I thought they were really nothing special. Not super crispy and meat was kind of stringy. I actually thought they smelled like stinky tofu, which was weird. What are all the rave reviews about??

Dan dan noodles were the strangest version of that dish I've seen. Since when did shrimp and calamari belong in a dish like that? The noodles were not cooked very well and the sauce was bright orange.

The rest was just mediocre and not really worth mentioning. All in all a somewhat unsatisfying dinner. I had to apologize to my dining partner for choosing this place.
author: deb s.

description:
My family and I had dinner here last night.  It's a great place for a family gathering.  The food was very tasty.  We ordered a wonton soup, fried beancurd with stringbeans, shrimp with caramelized walnuts, chow mein, chow fun, chicken wings (both non-spicy and spicy), sweet and sour pork, cashew chicken, and mongolian beef.  My favorite dishes were the cashew chicken, shrimp with caramelized walnuts and non-spicy chicken wings.  There was a generous amount of cashews in the cashew chicken.  The shrimp with caramelized walnuts was nice because the shrimp wasn't heavily battered and the sauce was light and tasty.  But, the BEST part of the dinner was the CHICKEN WINGS.  Because I can't eat spicy foods, I tried the non-spicy wings.  The chicken was nice and tender and the outside was crispy and covered with a delicious sauce.  They are on the same tier as the delicious wings at Hot Sauce & Panko and San Tung.  

The service was excellent.  It's a family business.  The wife was very attentive and friendly.  Our teapot was always full.  The food was bought out quickly and efficiently.  All dishes were freshly prepared and piping hot.  The fortune cookies were fresh and crunchy.

However, the wontons in the wonton soup need improvement.  The wonton wrapper was a bit too thick and chewy for me.  The filling was a bit sparse.  I prefer thin and silky wonton wrapper.  However, the wonton broth was clear and tasty.  The veggies were fresh and crisp.

btw, this is one of the cleanest Chinese restaurant I have eaten in in a long time.
author: Sherry C.

description:
New restaurant on Clement at 3rd avenue.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  The Spinach and Bean Curd Soup had a clean, peppery flavor.  The egg roll appetizer was good but a little on the small side. The Mongolian Beef was tender, and cooked at a hot wok temperature so the meat was flavorful.  The Chicken Chow Mein and Sweet and Sour Pork were a couple of notches above most Chinese restaurants.  And the Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings was the Bomb. The wings and drumsticks were big and they gave nine pieces on a plate. It was so addictive, I could have eaten that single dish by myself. I would say the same and maybe even better than San Tung.  

The folks running the restaurant are very nice.  She refilled my water without prompting.  Very relaxed environment, plain but tasteful decor.  High ceiling made it nice.  The only thing I would change is the pop music in the background.  They should put on some vintage chinese music instead.
author: D L.

description:
I hate to be that one person who gives a bad review, but I feel like it's my duty to because the only reason my family and I came here was because of the high rating on yelp. 

The only good thing about this restaurant is the cleanliness. I went here with my parents, brother and sister last Saturday, 3/30/13 and the entire experience was terrible. First, they were severely understaffed - they had one server doing to-go orders, and one server serving the ENTIRE restaurant...which was completely full. Our waters were empty for most of the meal. Second, the food came out SO slowly... the dishes literally came out one at a time. After we finished a dish, we had to wait another 5 minutes before the next dish came out. We were planning to share everything family style anyways.. but it was frustrating to have ONE dish to choose from and then wait for the next dish to come out. The food was good enough - but anyone who's actually eaten at an authentic Chinese restaurant in SF can tell you that it's overpriced for the portion size, and too way salty. We saw the same menu items at China First for $3 less (I've never been there, just saying).
We ordered
1) Eggplant Chicken - too salty
2) Mushu pork - alright
3) Wonton soup - alright
4) Pepper beef - way salty
and something else. Whatever it was, it wasn't memorable because I can't remember what it was.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Tried this place on spec from Yelp for lunch today.  Was initially put off by the fact that there were no other diners (this changed) and the blandness of the decor. 
For $42 we shared shredded pork with Garlic sauce,  sautéed string beans with tofu (delicious),  chicken with basil and enormous amounts of eggplant, brown rice and potstickers.   All good.  Especially the string beans.  We'll be back.
author: Tarbh G.

description: Great food. Wide ranging menu with all of the standards.
author: Tomas F.

description: Have only done takeout and it was fast. Food flavorful and not too salty and oily, and very good. The whole family devoured everything. They're on the go-to list!
author: Emily K.

description: We ordered delivery from Tenglong and were excited based on some of the reviews.  We had a pretty average to bad experience unfortunately.  They estimated 60 minutes for delivery and it actually came out to 1.5 hours.  We order cashew chicken (chicken was dark meat with fat still on it), chili shrimp (very good except swimming in sauce), Wonton Soup (some bones in the wontons) and steamed broccoli which is tough to get wrong.  I don't think we will be ordering again, although they were very friendly and apologetic about the long wait.  Would rather go to Eliza's and pick up the food myself.
author: J F.

description:
This is seriously very good. The hot-braised flounder filet is probably the best I have ever had. Very tasty, and doesn't feel much oily even it's deep fried.
The Original chicken wings is great too!
author: Jacky L.

description: it's worth it just for the wings Crispy, sweet and spicy. Adjust as you like but great wings and not over packed like San tung in sunset. Nice friendly service.
author: Silver C.

description:
What a sweet little place. Great vibe, excellent service. and piping hot food that comes out fast. And no msg! 

Loved the vegetarian sesame chicken, veggie chow fun and basil eggplant. And the brown rice was exceptionally tasty.

We wandered in off the street for a late lunch and it was perfect. They are open all afternoon. Am very happy to support this family-run local business. They take pride in what they serve and we left feeling nourished.
author: D. D.

description: Yum yum yum! The Vegetarian Sweet and a sour chicken is so delicious. You gotta try it! The Vegetarian fried rice is also very good and healthy. They care about quality not quantity. The owner is very personable and I wish her all the best of luck!  The decor is also vey tastefully done. Good quality food you woun't be dissapointed!
author: Christina S.

description: This place is soooo delicious! Everything I've eaten here tastes really fresh and well seasoned,also the portions are very generous. My favorite thing on the menu is the lemon chicken...order it and you will not be disappointed! Also,really fast delivery..like,I've literally placed an order and had it delivered to my house within 25 minutes. Also when I call in an order and pick it up,its always ready in 15 minutes,which is wonderful. Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I've had a couple of awkward experiences with the delivery guys regarding tipping. I paid and tipped on my card once and when delivery dude showed up,he acted kind of weird when I didn't give him a cash tip. I explained that I'd included his tip on my card and seemed annoyed and I found that off putting. Other time,I wanted to give 3.50 tip and the guy got pissed that I wasn't giving him $5. My order total was only $20 so I really didn't think it was such an insult to tip $3.50. But yeah..the food is top notch!
author: Pasha S.

description: Ordered online, waited an hour. Called and they said it was on the way. Twenty minutes passed. Turns out, it wasn't on the way. Called again, someone else answered and said it was on the way. It wasn't. Called again and apparently, my order never left the restaurant. They said they didn't know when it would be delivered so they would cancel it. No apology provided. A real, honest, accurate review of what happened. Don't know if the food is any good, but good operational processes and customer service are lacking to say the least.
author: Rocky B.

description: This is our go-to place for Chinese delivery. And the fact that it has stayed on our go-to list for almost two years is a credit to the consistent quality of the food they put out ... especially since we've tried a ton of other places in the area that have just not kept up their standards. Tenglong's menu is pretty standard fare and while there aren't any notable "best we've ever had" dishes, we've always been happy with the typical Chinese dishes we ordered. Also, we've actually been into the restaurant itself on Clement and were happy to see it was clean and neat (i.e., not one of those places you order delivery from until you happen to see the actual restaurant and say "we're never ordering from there again").
author: Dave E.

description:
After reading all the reviews, I thought this would be a great place but there is nothing special about this restaurant besides the friendly waitress who is also the owner.

Of course we had to try the dry fry chicken when we were here, nothing special really.  It is NOT as good as San Tung's version.   The chicken isn't bad here but it's nothing to write home about.  We also had the tomato beef noodle, boy this was gross.  The beef on the noddle had this hard chewy texture and the noodle lacked any tomato flavor to it.  It had a orange color to it no flavor at all.  Last, we also had the wonton soup based on the waitress's suggestion.  All I can say is water, msg, and  chilli powder dump together and boil.
author: Guess G.

description:
Wonderful Chinese food, from a couple who have had restaurants before and know how to take care of you.
Don't miss it!
author: Kathy C.

description: Overrated. Bland fried rice. Soup was not good, no flavor. Vegetable fried rice and seafood soup was $20. Wouldn't mind paying this ridiculous high price if it was good. The waitress was nice.
author: John C.

description: Its certainly not gourmet food, but this place is clean and tasty with a friendly staff that puts it far above other Chinese take-out places. The food is tasty and inexpensive, but most importantly its not as heavy and greasy as most Chinese places. If you're looking for take-out or some Chinese comfort food in the inner Richmod there is absolutely nowhere better!
author: Double T.

description: The beef chow fun was pretty good. The dry chicken wings were pretty good too, but there was a little too much white pepper. I might eat here again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, since there are so many other places to explore. Maybe I would I rated this place higher, if the service were better. Overall, my experience was okay.
author: Chris N.

description: Awesome staff who are super friendly!  Good sweet and sour pork and ma po tofu
author: Lisa B.

description: We saw that one of the things this restaurant does well is quick delivery, but on a Sunday night, we had to wait almost 2hours for our food. We called after an hour and were told our order was on its way. After 1 hour and 40 minutes, we called again and were told that our order was *just* put in and that it would be to us shortly. They apologized, asked if we wanted free appetizers which we declined. They asked what they could do, I said a discount, they said fine, and then hung up!! We ordered through their website, so maybe that was our mistake. But don't have online ordering if you don't know how to use it.
author: sfmarzan o.

description: Dry fried chicken wings are out of this world. I crave them once every couple of months and have to go back. That's about it though... The rest of the food is average at best. Clean nice place with friendly people.
author: Michael S.

description: Less than 10% of Chinese restaurants in SF is good, this is one of them. they use high quality laminated paper for their takeouts, not the cheap transparent plastic most uses. They don't use starch as their sauces, they uses white chicken meat. Everything taste good and only $1 more for each menu item when compared to other Chinese restaurants.
author: Robert S.

description: Best Chinese in the inner richmond. Dry Fried Diced Chicken is very good, as is Sweet and Sour Pork.
author: Ben P.

description: Great to have a new Chinese restaurant in the Inner Richmond district.  Their dried fried chicken is as good as anywhere in San Francisco, including San Tung.  Actually, I prefer the drier texture over the way it's served at most Chinese/Korean restaurants.  The restaurant is clean and the owner's put some effort into the decor.  The environment is not too loud and service is excellent.  The food overall was very good.
author: Robert C.

description:
I have eaten there a  few times.  The first time I had a lunch on my own - veggies with tofu strips.  There were 4 tiny tofu strips -- I asked why there were so few and was told that was because it was a luncheon plate, which is half of the dinner plate.  I asked if that mean only 8 tiny tofu strips with the dinner - and was told it did!  Not adequate.
A friend and I returned to try some other dishes.  Both were unsatisfactory.  The fried rice plate didn't have enough rice, but it did have large chunks of broccoli and cabbage.  Lacking were any other vegetable, and it was very bland.  In addition, we ordered the tofu, nuts and broccoli.  It did not look like the photo on the menu - it had  more large chunks of broccoli, not enough fried tofu or nuts.  The waitress did not warn us when we ordered that that fried rice was also heavy on the broccoli -  we really had more of a broccoli meal with little variety.  The waitress seemed not to care that we were unsatisfied with our meal.
I recommend going to other places that give better value with more flavor and a more responsive serving staff.
author: Greg M.

description: After my last experience with this place I've decided I can't ever order from here again.     I live close, so I order pretty regularly, and I like the food, I'd give them a solid 4 stars just for that.  But today I had to order delivery since my car decided to take a dump on me.  I ordered the kung pao chicken and the beef with oyster sauce.  They brought me kung pao chicken and some other sort of chicken something i have no idea.  Okay, mistakes happen, so I called back.  They then brought me some sort of beef dish i don't even see on the menu.  Damnit.  Minus two stars.
author: Mari V.

description: The staff was really nice, the tables & bathroom were clean, and the food was good. The chicken wings were crispy + had yummy sauce, and the tofu with veggies had a spicy and slightly sour sauce. For dinner, most dishes were about $9-$10, and it came out to $14 per person with tip.
author: Annie O.

description: WONDERFUL!! We were at the DeYoung museum for the Dutch Master's exhibit and wanted to have a nice lunch before heading back to Half Moon Bay. This restaurant was not far and we managed to find a parking spot within a block (wow! on a Sunday afternoon)... The food was very tasty, sauces were delicate, and dishes were piping hot when delivered! Nothing we got was overly oily, in fact quite the opposite, the cooking oil was almost undetectable. We had pot stickers-great taste and texture, the prawns in lobster sauce was loaded with prawns and the sauce was delicate and delicious, the jasmine rice was cooked just right, and I had the vegetable dish [they even adjusted the dish to exclude one vegetable I really don't like] and the vegetables were so good I manage to clean the plate. We will be going back again anytime we are in the city because it was that good. My only negative would be the temperature- it was a little on the chilly side so take a sweater as a precaution.... The staff was delightful...Christina is very engaging and our overall experience was memorable.... thank you
author: Nancy H.

description: My friend told me about this restraunt and he was telling me how great it was so i went in and tried it. It was my first time trying this place and im usually picky about my food, but this place was pretty bomb! It didnt take that long to make the food and the people there were very kind.
author: natasha l.

description: Go try the wings! I also tried their chicken with basil and eggplant and that was really tasty, too. They are adding more items to their menu, like Dan Dan Mein and Ja Jiang Mein, so I can't wait to try them. The place is super clean. The owners are really nice and efficient. Definitely a nice new addition to the Inner Richmond.
author: A L.

description: Delicious friendly clean new chinese option on clement! Dry fried chicken was at least comparable to San Tung ( I liked it a little better, a little more pepper!). Beef Tomato chow mein was kind of like noodles + sweet and sour sauce. I liked it, but a little sweet. Hope these guys do well here, we could use more quality chinese options
author: Chris C.

description: There are tons of Chinese Restaurants on clement but if you are looking for one that is clean this is the place. The customer service here is great! It's a family owned business so everyone is super nice. Also, the place looks recently renovated and looks very clean. Usually, I don't use the soy sauce plates Usually, I don't prefer Chinese food but this place changed my mind. There dumplings are to die for. Its not too salty nor tasteless. They have the right about of meat and vegetables. It's just right. Also, if you come here the Chicken Wings and string beans with tofu are great too. At the end, they gave us a big plate of fortune cookies. Usually, Chinese restaurant's don't give these away. The food came extremely quick.
author: Henry C.

description: We, too, felt like were in the owners' own home. We brought our kids, and yes, it is family friendly.  Decor was clean and bright.  The food was really good. We can recommend the hot & sour soup, chow mein and fried rice. Onion pancake was good too.   The green beans were cooked perfectly, but a little spicy for some in our group. The garlic pork was delicious.  The consensus around the table was that the quality of the ingredients was better than other Chinese places we go to regularly. It is a bit more expensive too, but well worth it.  This one is entering the rotation.
author: Erin N.

description: Today I was happy to discover this restaurant named Teng Long. I had observed lately there was renovation going on inside this location, which was previously a Vietnamese restaurant. I was surprised to find it reopened so soon by a new owner/chef.  For lunch I ordered their Beef with Green Onions, with a big scoop of steamed rice. The order also came with a cup of very tasty hot & sour soup, and a complimentary egg roll. The large portion of beef was very tender and juicy, stir fried with green onion, white onion and minced garlic, with just the right amount of delicious sauce. I could tell right away that it was good quality beef. I think Teng Long's Lunch Specials are amazing. I could see 20 different lunch plates, each comes with soup and rice like the one I ordered, all ranging from $8.50 to $9. Their style of cooking is quite diversed, both Mandarin, Cantonese and some Sichuan flavors, all great for meat lovers and vegetarians alike. Their new decor is tastefully done and clean. The waitststaff is attentive and courteous. This was only my first dining experience at Teng Long and I found it very satisfying!
author: J L.
